text.section:
The Administration shall:
File each application for a certificate of title that it receives; and
Issue a certificate of title of the vehicle if:
It finds that the applicant is entitled to the certificate of title; and
It has received the required fees.

The Administration shall keep a record of all certificates of title that it issues, as follows:
Under a distinctive title number assigned to the vehicle;
Under the vehicle identification number of the vehicle or, if a distinguishing number has been assigned to it, under the distinguishing number; and
Under any other method that the Administration determines.

Upon receipt with the application for a certificate of title, the Administration shall maintain a record of the following documents as a part of its certificate of title records for a motor vehicle:
A notice from a dealer under § 14-1502(f)(1) of the Commercial Law Article;
A notice from a manufacturer or factory branch under § 14-1502(f)(2) of the Commercial Law Article; and
A manufacturer's disclosure form provided to the Administration under § 14-1502(g) of the Commercial Law Article.

section.section: The Administration shall issue a permanent decal to the owner of a motor scooter or moped for which a certificate of title is issued.
An owner of a motor scooter or moped for which a certificate of title is issued shall display the decal on the vehicle as prescribed by the Administration.
A decal shall display a unique number sequence assigned by the Administration.

The Administration:
Shall establish a fee of $5 for a decal; and
May adopt regulations to implement this section.
